intro: Arabis halleri, commonly known as the rock白菜 or alpine cabbage, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. It produces small, white or pale purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The leaves are usually basal, rosette-like, and have a slightly hairy texture.
